content: This was reported in the Cincinnati news today' U.S. Customs agents say they've stopped a massive shipment of weapons from entering the United States through the Cincinnati Northern Kentucky International Airport. Customs and Border Patrol agents made the seizure yesterday. The shipment, manifested as "Toys" was valued at $14,000 and shipped in 25 boxes from Istanbul, Turkey. Agents decided to search the boxes after it was determined the weapons had arrived without the proper permits. They found 60 pump action 12-gauge shotguns and 177 pistols. The shotguns were encased in Styrofoam molding and individually packaged in 12 large boxes. The pistols were shipped within hard plastic gun storage cases packed inside 13 large cardboard boxes. The guns were destined for a business located in Kentucky. Neither the shotguns nor pistols were found to have any serial numbers or markings. Agents say this is the largest seizure of weapons ever made by CBP in Cincinnati. I am all in favor of rights to own guns and own guns myself but it worrys me that guns are shipped into this country labeled as "toys" and without serial numbers.

content: That's easy...you "walk the (paper) trail" each way...to the KY business, and back to Istanbul, Turkey shipper/arms dealer with Interpol...no sweat. The Mexican Army has been selling the Drug Dragons in Mexico's cartels .50 Cals and all kinds of stuff, and NOT from the US, either. Many drug cartel guns and ammo are being shipped right into Mexico from...(drum roll...) CHINA! Surprise! NOT! Yet our Congress is LYING and twisting the facts around. Everyone knows that if you even get CAUGHT in MEXICO WITH AN EXPENDED ROUND, YOU'RE TOAST! NO GUN(S)...JUST A SPENT ROUND WIll DO YOU IN, EVEN A LITTLE RIMFIRE .22!Wanna play "roulette" withthe money-hungry Mexican Federales or "Aduaneros"? Remember the innocent kid some years ago who was unlucky enough to have had a SPENT .22 cartridge--NO GUN--in the car; got stopped in Mexico, and inspected...that was a costly expended .22LR shell! Congress is full of crap on this 'cause' for the most part.

content: I doubt the guns are going across at many border crossings. More likely low flying aircraft, boats, tunnels and even small submarines. All have been used by drug runners coming this way. No use going home empty. I used to do drug interdiction with radar. They can get pretty inventive to avoid detection, but the biggest problem came with Clinton. He stopped the majority of military involvement with drug interdiction, and the flood gate of drugs and illegals flew wide open - - Wandering and Wondering

content: Weapons probably came from the former Yugoslavian states and Albania. The Italians have been stopping illegal weapons coming across the Adriatic for years. "Toys" is a common ruse to bypass Customs inspection. China is the biggest abuser. The general public has no idea about the volume of misdeclared cargo moving around the world.
